laboratory_examinations.findings: Serum potassium values were between 3.4 to 4.0 mEq/L during hospitalization, with instances of 2.3 and 3.0 mEq/L, and exceeding 4.0 mEq/L (4.4 or 4.0 mEq/L) after attacks.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Potassium levels demonstrated fluctuations; lower values during paralytic episodes and increased values without supplementation after episodes.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Decreased T wave amplitude and appearance of U wave on ECG when potassium levels were 2.3 and 3.0 mEq/L.
Frequent myotonic repetitive discharges noted, absent during paralytic episodes.
Occasional tubular aggregates on Gomori-trichrome staining without other pathologic changes.
